'''Stye=''''' furuncle of the free edge of the eyelid centred on a pilosebaceous follicle of the eyelash.

It corresponds to a bacterial infection, most often with Staphylococcus aureus, of the pilosebaceous follicle. It develops over a few days and can cause severe pain. Clinically, it appears as a red swelling centred by a white dot at the free edge. Secretions are not always present at first.

properties.question: What is the primary characteristic of a stye?
properties.option_a: A bacterial infection of the eyelid follicle, often caused by Staphylococcus aureus.
properties.option_b: A benign growth on the eyelid, usually appearing as a small, red bump.
properties.option_c: A type of conjunctivitis, characterized by excessive tearing and redness.
properties.option_d: A condition where the eyelid is excessively flaccid and prone to tearing.
